meanings.definition: Below the lowest C note on a piano.
meanings.sent1: The subcontraoctave is the deepest sound on the piano.
meanings.sent2: The musician played a haunting melody in the subcontraoctave.
meanings.sent3: The subcontraoctave whispered secrets to the other notes.
meanings.sent4: Her voice reached the subcontraoctave of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The subcontraoctave resonated with a powerful rumble.

meanings.definition: An interval of an octave and a fifth below a given note.
meanings.sent1: The subcontraoctave creates a rich harmony in the music.
meanings.sent2: The composer used the subcontraoctave to add depth to the piece.
meanings.sent3: The subcontraoctave decided to take a nap, leaving the other notes to play alone.
meanings.sent4: His words hit me in the subcontraoctave of my heart.
meanings.sent5: The subcontraoctave echoed through the room, filling it with warmth.
